intro: Argostemma setosum, commonly known as the hairy argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
